title: doctest-modules with NUMBER option ignores zero decimal precision

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: problem that needs to be addressed

labels.name: plugin: doctests
labels.description: related to the doctests builtin plugin

body:
<!--
Thanks for submitting an issue!

Quick check-list while reporting bugs:
-->

- [x] a detailed description of the bug or problem you are having
- [x] output of `pip list` from the virtual environment you are using
- [x] pytest and operating system versions
- [x] minimal example if possible


# Description
This was found in https://github.com/pyvista/pyvista/pull/2511.  Using NUMBER option causes zero-precision numbers to pass when the numbers are off by 1 by not by 2.  Also using NUMBER option in a module causes this behavior to leak out into other docstring tests that do not use NUMBER.  Not using NUMBER correctly fails the tests.

Thanks to @adeak who identified the off by 1 but not by 2 aspect of this.


Using commands `pytest --doctest-modules test_1.py` and `pytest --doctest-modules test_2.py`.

# MRE

```py
# test_1.py
def list_1():
    """
    Passes

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [0.]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [1.]
    """

def list_2():
    """
    Passes

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [0.]
    """

def list_3():
    """
    Passes

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [0.0]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [1.]
    """

def list_4():
    """
    Passes

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.0]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [0.]
    """

def list_5():
    """
    Passes

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [2.]
    """

def list_6():
    """
    Fails

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.]
    [3.]
    """


def list_7():
    """
    Fails
    
    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.1]  # doctest: +NUMBER
    [0.]
    """

def list_8():
    """
    Passes in this module

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.]  
    [0.]
    """
```

```py
# test_2.py
def list_8():
    """
    Fails in this module

    Examples
    --------
    >>> [1.]  
    [0.]
    """
```
